summary.long: Jeremiah is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The words of Hilkiah’s son Jeremiah, who was one of the priests at Anathoth in the territory of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This message from the Lord came to him during the thirteenth year of the reign of Ammon’s son Josiah, the king of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and during the reign of Josiah’s son Jehoiakim, the king of Judah, and continued until the exile of Jerusalem in the fifth month, at the end of the eleventh year of the reign of Josiah’s son Zedekiah, the king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This message from the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: I replied, “Ah, Lord God! Look, I don’t know how to speak, because I’m only a young man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told me, “Don’t say, ‘I’m only a young man,’ for you will go everywhere I send you, and you will speak everything I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t be afraid of them, because I am with you to deliver you,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord stretched out his hand, touched my mouth, and then told me, “Look, I’ve put my words in your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See, today I’ve appointed you to prophesy about nations and kingdoms, to pull up and tear down, to destroy and overthrow, to build and to plant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This message from the Lord came to me, asking, “What do you see, Jeremiah?”
I replied, “I see an almond branch.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told me, “You have observed well, because I’m watching over my message, to make sure it comes about.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This message from the Lord came to me a second time: “What do you see?”
I replied, “I see a boiling pot, and its mouth is tilted away from the north.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told me, “From the north disaster will pour out on all who live in the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because I’m about to summon all the families and kingdoms from the north,” declares the Lord.
“They’ll come and each one will set up his seat
    at the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem,
against all of its surrounding walls,
    and against all of the towns of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I’ll pronounce my judgments against them
    because of all their wickedness.
They have forsaken me,
    they have burned incense to other gods,
and they have bowed down in worship
    to the works of their own hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, get ready! Stand up and tell them everything that I’ve commanded you. Don’t be frightened as you face them, or I’ll frighten you right in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for me, today I’m making you a fortified city, an iron pillar, and a bronze wall against the whole land—against the kings of Judah, against its princes, against its priests, and against the people of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They’ll fight against you, but they won’t prevail against you, because I am with you,” declares the Lord, “to deliver you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This message from the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go and announce to Jerusalem:
‘This is what the Lord says:
“I remember the loyal devotion of your youth,
    your love as a bride.
You followed me in the desert,
    in a land that was not planted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel was consecrated to the Lord,
    she was the first fruits of his produce.
All who devoured her became guilty
    and disaster came on them,”
        declares the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to this message from the Lord,
    you descendants of Jacob
        and all the families of the descendants of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“What did your ancestors find wrong with me
    that they left me,
and pursued worthless things,
    and so they became worthless?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They didn’t ask, ‘Where is the Lord
    who brought us up from the land of Egypt,
who led us through the wilderness,
    through the land of desert and pits,
through the land of dryness and deep darkness,
    a land that people don’t pass through,
        and where no one lives?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I brought you into the fruitful land to eat its fruit
    and its good things.
But you came in, defiled my land,
    and made my inheritance into an abomination.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The priests didn’t say, ‘Where is the Lord?’
    and those handling the Law didn’t know me.
The rulers transgressed against me,
    the prophets prophesied by Baal,
        and they followed that which does not profit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore I’ll again accuse you,”
    declares the Lord,
“and I’ll accuse your grandchildren.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Indeed, go over to the coasts of Cyprus and see,
    send to Kedar and pay very close attention.
        See if there has ever been such a thing as this!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Has a nation ever changed gods
    when they aren’t even gods?
But my people have exchanged their glory
    for that which does not profit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Heavens, be appalled at this,
    be shocked, be utterly devastated,”
        declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Indeed, my people have committed two evils:
    they have forsaken me, the fountain of living water,
and they have dug cisterns for themselves,
    broken cisterns that cannot hold water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Is Israel a slave, or was he born a servant?
    Why then has he become plunder?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Young lions roar at him, they cry out loudly.
    They have made his land into a wasteland,
and his cities are destroyed
    so they are without inhabitants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also, people from Memphis and Tahpanhes
    have broken your skull.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have done this to yourselves, have you not,
    by forsaking the Lord your God, when he
        is the one who led you on the way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now, what are you doing on the road to Egypt,
    to drink the waters of the Nile?
And what are you doing on the road to Assyria,
    to drink the waters of the Euphrates?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wickedness will be punished,
    and you will be corrected due to your acts of apostasy.
Know and see that it’s evil and bitter for you
    to forsake the Lord your God,
but the fear of me is not in you,”
    declares the Lord God of the Heavenly Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For long ago I broke your yoke
    and tore off your bonds,
But you said, ‘I won’t serve you!’
    Instead, on every high hill
and under every green tree,
    you bend down to commit fornication.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I planted you myself as a choice vine,
    from the very best seed.
How did you turn against me
    into a degenerate and foreign vine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though you wash yourself with lye
    and use much soap,
the stain of your guilt is still before me,”
        declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How can you say, ‘I’m not defiled.
    I haven’t gone after the Baals.’?
Look at what you’ve done in the valley.
    Know what you have done.
        You are a swift young camel galloping aimlessly;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a wild donkey accustomed to the desert,
    sniffing the wind in her passion.
When she’s in heat,
    who can turn her away?
None of the males who pursue her need to tire themselves out,
    for in her month they’ll find her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Don’t run until your feet are bare
    and your throat is dry.
But you say, ‘It’s hopeless!
    Because I love foreign gods, I’ll go after them!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“As a thief is disgraced when he’s caught,
    so the house of Israel is disgraced—
        they, their kings, their princes, their priests, and their prophets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who say to a tree, ‘You are my father,’
    and to a stone, ‘You gave birth to me.’
They have turned their back to me,
    but not their faces.
In the time of their trouble, they’ll say,
    ‘Rise up! Deliver us!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But where are your gods
    that you made for yourselves?
Let them rise up, if they can deliver you
    in the time of your trouble.
        You have as many gods as you have towns, Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you contend with me?
    You have rebelled against me,”
        declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I’ve punished your children with no results,
    they have accepted no discipline.
Your sword has devoured your prophets
    like a destroying lion.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You, generation,
    pay attention to this message from the Lord!
Am I the desert to Israel,
    or a land of gloom?
Why do my people say, ‘We’re free to roam?
    We won’t come to you anymore.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will a young woman forget her wedding ornaments,
    or a bride her attire?
But my people have forgotten me
    days without number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How well you perfect your techniques for seeking love.
    Therefore you can teach even the most immoral women your techniques.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On your skirts is found the lifeblood of the innocent poor,
    even though you didn’t catch them breaking in.
Yet despite all these things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you say, ‘I’m innocent.
        Surely his anger has turned away from me.’” 
“I’m about to bring charges against you
    because you say, ‘I haven’t sinned.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you go about changing your mind so much?
    You will also be disappointed by Egypt,
        just as you were disappointed by Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will also go out from this place
    with your hands over your heads.
For the Lord has rejected those in whom you trust,
    and you won’t prosper through them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“When a man divorces his wife, she leaves him and
becomes another man’s wife,
will the first husband return to her again?
        The land would be deeply polluted, would it not?
Since you have committed fornication with many lovers,
    would you now return to me?”
        declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Look up to the barren heights and see.
    Is there any place where you have not been ravished?
You have sat beside the road, waiting for them
    like a nomad in the desert.
And you have polluted the land
    with your fornication and your wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is why the rain has been withheld
    and there are no spring showers.
Yet you have a harlot’s look
    and you refuse to be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you not just called out to me,
    ‘My father, you are the friend of my youth—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
will he hold on to his anger forever,
    will he persist in his wrath to the end?’
Look, you have spoken and done evil things,
    and you have succeeded in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the time of King Josiah the Lord told me, “Have you seen what unfaithful Israel did? She went up on every high hill and under every green tree, and she committed fornication there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thought, ‘After she has done all these things, she will return to me.’ But she didn’t return, and her treacherous sister Judah saw this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw that even though I had sent unfaithful Israel away for all her adulteries and had given her a divorce decree, her treacherous sister Judah didn’t fear, and she, too, committed adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She took her fornication so lightly that she polluted the land and committed adultery with stones and trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet in all this her treacherous sister Judah didn’t return to me with her whole heart, but rather deceptively,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told me, “Unfaithful Israel has shown herself more righteous than treacherous Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go, proclaim these words to the north, and say,
‘Return, unfaithful Israel,’
    declares the Lord.
‘I won’t look on you in anger,
    for I am gracious,’
        declares the Lord.
‘I won’t remain angry forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Only acknowledge your iniquity,
    that you have rebelled against the Lord your God,
    and have scattered your favors to strangers
        under every green tree.
But you haven’t obeyed me,’
        declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Return, unfaithful people,” declares the Lord, “for I am your husband. I’ll take you, one from a city and two from a family, and I’ll bring you to Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll give you shepherds after my own heart, and they’ll shepherd you with knowledge and good sense.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And in those days when you increase in numbers and multiply in the land,” declares the Lord, “people will no longer say, ‘The Ark of the Covenant of the Lord,’ and it won’t come to mind, and they won’t remember it or miss it, nor will it be made again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time people will call Jerusalem, “The Throne of the Lord,” and all the nations will be gathered to it, to the name of the Lord, to Jerusalem. They’ll no longer stubbornly follow their own evil desires.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days the house of Judah will walk with the house of Israel, and together they’ll come to the land that I gave your ancestors as an inheritance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I said,
‘How I wanted to treat you like children,
    and give you a pleasant land,
        the most beautiful inheritance of the nations.’
I said, ‘You will call me, my father,
    and won’t turn back from following me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Instead, like an unfaithful wife leaves her husband,
    so you have been unfaithful to me, house of Israel,”
        declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A voice is heard on the barren heights,
    the weeping and pleading of the children of Israel
because they have perverted their way.
    They have forgotten the Lord their God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Turn back, unfaithful people,
    and I’ll heal your unfaithfulness.”
“Look, we’re coming to you
    because you are the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truly the hills are a deception,
    and the mountains are confusion.
        Truly, in the Lord our God is Israel’s salvation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Since our youth the false gods have consumed
    the products of our ancestors’ hard work,
their sheep and their cattle,
    their sons and their daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Let us lie down in our shame,
    and let our humiliation cover us,
because both we and our ancestors have sinned
    against the Lord our God from our youth
        until this present time.
We haven’t obeyed the Lord our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Israel, if you return to me,”
declares the Lord,
“Return to me,
    remove your detestable idols from my presence,
        and don’t waver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you swear, ‘as surely as the Lord lives,’
    in truth, in justice, and in righteousness,
then nations will be blessed by him,
    and in him they will boast.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is what the Lord says
    to the men of Judah and Jerusalem,
“Break up your unplowed ground,
    and don’t sow among thorns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Circumcise yourselves to the Lord
    and remove the foreskin of your heart,
you men of Judah and residents of Jerusalem,
    or else my wrath will break out like fire
and burn with no one to put it out,
    because of your evil deeds.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Declare in Judah, make known in Jerusalem, by saying,
    “Blow the trumpet in the land, cry out, and say,
‘Gather together
    and let’s go to the fortified cities!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Raise a standard in the direction of Zion.
    Flee! Don’t stand around!
For I’m bringing calamity from the north,
    along with great destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A lion has gone up from his thicket,
    and a destroyer of nations has set out.
He has left his place
    to make your land a waste.
Your cities will be ruined,
    and without inhabitants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So, put on sackcloth,
    mourn and wail,
because the burning anger of the Lord
    has not turned away from us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“On that day,” declares the Lord,
    “the courage of the king and the leaders will fail.
The priests will be appalled
    and the prophets astounded.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I replied, “Ah, Lord God, you have completely deceived this people and Jerusalem when you said, ‘You will have peace,’ while the sword is at their throat!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, it will be told this people and to Jerusalem, “A scorching wind from the barren heights in the desert is coming toward my people, and it’s not for winnowing or cleansing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A wind too strong for that is coming at my bidding. Now I’m judging them as I speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, he comes up like clouds,
    and his chariots are like a whirlwind.
His horses are as swift as eagles.
    Woe to us—we’re destroyed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jerusalem, wash your evil from your heart
    so that you may be delivered.
How long will you harbor
    evil schemes within you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a voice announces from Dan
    and declares disaster from Mount Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Tell the nations, ‘Here they come!’
    Proclaim to Jerusalem,
‘The besieging forces are coming from a distant land.
    They cry out against the cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have surrounded her like those guarding a field
    because they have rebelled against me,’”
        declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Your lifestyles and your actions
    have brought these things on you.
This is your calamity—it is indeed bitter,
    for it has reached your heart!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“My anguish, my anguish! I writhe in pain.
    Oh, the aching of my heart!
My heart pounds within me;
    I cannot keep silent.
For I hear the sound of the trumpet,
    the alarm for war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Disaster upon disaster is proclaimed,
    for the entire land is devastated.
Suddenly, my tent is destroyed,
    in a moment my curtains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will I see the battle standard
    and hear the sound of the trumpet?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For my people are foolish,
    they don’t know me.
They’re stupid children,
    they have no understanding.
They’re skilled at doing evil,
    but how to do good, they don’t know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I looked at the earth, and it was formless and void,
    at the heavens, and there was no light there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I looked at the mountains; they were quaking,
    and all the hills moved back and forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I looked, and no people were there.
    All the birds of the sky had gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I looked, and the fruitful land had become a desert.
    All its towns were broken down
because of the Lord,
    because of his burning anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is what the Lord says:
“The entire land will be devastated,
    but I won’t completely destroy it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of this, the land will mourn,
    and the heavens above will be dark.
Because I have spoken and decided,
    I won’t turn back from doing it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the sound of the horseman and the archer
    the entire city flees.
Its residents go into the thickets and climb among the rocks.
    Every city is abandoned, and no one lives in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are ruined! What are you doing
    dressing in scarlet,
putting on golden ornaments,
    and highlighting your eyes with makeup?
You are making yourself beautiful in vain.
    Your lovers reject you—
        they’re out to kill you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I heard a cry like that of a woman in labor,
    anguish like one giving birth to her firstborn,
the cry of the daughter of Zion gasping for air,
    stretching out her hand:
    “Woe is me! I’m about to faint in front of killers!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Wander through the streets of Jerusalem.
Look and investigate;
search through her squares
    and see whether you find anyone—
even one person there—doing justice and seeking truth.
    Then I’ll forgive them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Although they say, ‘As surely as the Lord lives,’
    still they are swearing falsely.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, don’t your eyes look for truth?
    You struck them, but they didn’t flinch.
You brought them to an end,
    but they refused to receive discipline.
They made their faces harder than stone,
    and they refused to repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said, “These are only the poor,
    they’re foolish,
for they don’t know the Lord’s way,
    the requirement of their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let me go to the leaders and speak to them.
    For they know the Lord’s way,
        the requirement of their God.”
“But they, all together, have broken the yoke
    and torn off the restraints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore a lion from the forest will attack them,
    a wolf from the desert will devastate them.
A leopard is watching their towns,
    and everyone who goes out of them
        will be torn to pieces.
For their transgressions are many,
    and their apostasies numerous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should I forgive you?
    Your sons have forsaken me,
and you have sworn by those
    who aren’t gods.
When I gave them enough food to satisfy them,
    they committed adultery
    and marched to the prostitute’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were well-fed, lusty stallions,
    each one neighing after his neighbor’s wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Should I not punish them for these things?”
    asks the Lord,
“And on a nation like this,
    should I not seek retribution?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go through her rows of vines and destroy them,
    but don’t completely destroy them.
Strip away her branches,
    because they aren’t the Lord’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For both the house of Israel and the house of Judah
    have been utterly unfaithful to me,”
        declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They have lied about the Lord
    by saying, ‘He wouldn’t do that!
Disaster won’t come on us.
    We won’t see sword and famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The prophets are nothing but wind,
    and the word is not in them.
So may the disaster happen to them!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, this is what the Lord God of the Heavenly Armies says:
“Because you people have said this,
    my words in your mouth will become a fire
        and these people the wood.
    The fire will destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People of Israel, I’m now bringing
    a nation from far away to attack you,”
        declares the Lord.
“It is an enduring nation,
    an ancient nation,
a nation whose language you don’t know.
    And you won’t understand what they say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their quiver is like an open grave,
    and all of them are powerful warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They’ll devour your harvest and your food.
    They’ll devour your sons and your daughters.
        They’ll devour your vines and your fig trees.
With their swords they’ll batter down
    your fortified cities in which you trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yet even in those days,” declares the Lord, “I won’t destroy you completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people ask, ‘Why has the Lord our God done all this to us?’ you are to say to them, ‘Just as you have forsaken me and served foreign gods in your land, so you will serve strangers in a land that is not yours.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Declare this to the descendants of Jacob,
    and proclaim it in Judah:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
‘You don’t fear me, do you?’ declares the Lord.
    ‘You don’t tremble before me, do you?
I’m the one who put the sand as a boundary for the sea,
    a perpetual barrier that it cannot cross.
Though the waves toss, they cannot prevail against it,
    though they roar, they cannot cross it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But these people have stubborn and rebellious hearts.
    They have turned aside and have gone away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They don’t say to themselves,
    ‘Let’s fear the Lord our God,
who gives rain in its season,
    both the autumn and the spring rain.
He sets aside for us the weeks appointed
    for the harvest.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your iniquities have turned these things away,
    and your sins have held back from you what is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Evil men are found among my people.
    They lie in wait like someone who traps birds.
They set a trap,
    but they do so to catch people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a cage full of birds,
    so their houses are filled with treachery.
This is how they have become prominent and rich,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and have grown fat and sleek.
There is no limit to their evil deeds.
    They don’t argue the case of the orphan to secure justice.
        They don’t defend the rights of the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Should I not punish them for this?’
    asks the Lord.
‘Should I not avenge myself
    on a nation like this?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“An appalling and horrible thing
    has happened in the land:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The prophets prophesy falsely,
    the priests rule by their own authority,
and my people love it this way.
    But what will you do in the end?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Flee to safety, you people of Benjamin,
leave Jerusalem.
Sound the trumpet in Tekoa,
    and raise a signal over Beth-haccerem!
For calamity and terrible destruction
    are turning toward you from the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ll destroy the lovely and delicate
    Daughter of Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shepherds and their flocks will come against her.
    They’ll pitch their tents all around her,
        and every one will tend his flock in his own place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Prepare for war against her.
    Get ready, let’s attack at noon!
How terrible for us that the day is coming to an end,
    and that the evening shadows are lengthening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Get ready, let’s attack at night,
    and destroy her fortresses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is what the Lord of the Heavenly Armies says:
“Cut down trees and
    set up siege works against Jerusalem.
It is the city to be judged,
    and there is oppression throughout the entire city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a well keeps its waters fresh,
    so the city keeps her wickedness fresh.
Violence and destruction are heard in her,
    sickness and wounds are always before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be warned, Jerusalem,
    or I’ll be alienated from you.
I’ll make you desolate,
    a land not inhabited.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord of the Heavenly Armies says:
“Let them glean the remnant of Israel
    as thoroughly as they would the vine.
Pass your hand over them like grape gatherers
    over the branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To whom will I speak and give a warning
    so they’ll listen?
Look, their ears are closed,
    and they cannot hear.
Look, this message from the Lord is contemptible to them;
    they don’t delight in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’m full of the wrath of the Lord,
    and I’m tired of holding it back.
Pour it out on the children in the street
    and on the groups of young men gathered together.
Indeed, both husband and wife will be caught in it,
    the old and the very old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their houses will be turned over to others—
    their fields and wives together—
when I stretch out my hand against
    those who live in the land,”
        declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Indeed, from the least important to the most important,
    they’re all greedy for dishonest gain.
From prophet to priest,
    they all act deceitfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They treated my people’s wound superficially, telling them,
    ‘Peace, peace,’ but there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Were they ashamed because they did
    what was repugnant to God?
They were not ashamed at all—
    they don’t even know how to blush!
Therefore they’ll fall with those who fall.
    When I punish them, they’ll be brought down,”
        says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“Stand beside the roads and watch.
    Ask for the ancient paths, where the good way is.
Walk in it and find rest for yourselves.
    But they said, ‘We won’t walk in it!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I appointed watchmen over you.
    Listen for the sound of the trumpet.
But they said, ‘We won’t listen!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, hear, nations,
    and know, congregation,
        what will happen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, earth!
    I’m about to bring calamity on this people,
        on the fruit of their plans,
because they didn’t listen to my words
    and they rejected my instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What good is frankincense
    that comes from Sheba to me,
        or sweet cane from a distant country?
Your burnt offerings aren’t acceptable,
    nor are your sacrifices pleasing to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, this is what the Lord says:
“I’m about to put stumbling blocks in front of this people,
    and fathers and sons will stumble over them together.
        The neighbor and his friends will perish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“Look, people are coming from a northern country.
    A great nation is stirring from the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They grab bow and spear;
    they’re cruel and show no mercy.
Their sound roars like the sea
    as they ride on horses,
deployed like men ready for battle
    against you, daughter of Zion.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have heard the news about it,
    and our hands are limp.
Distress has seized us
    like a woman in labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Don’t go out into the field,
    and don’t travel on the road,
because the enemy has a sword,
    and terror is on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Daughter of my people, put on sackcloth
    and roll in ashes.
Mourn with bitter wailing,
    as one mourns at the death of an only son.
For the destroyer will come on us suddenly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I’ve made you an assayer of my people,
    as well as a fortress.
You know how
    to test their way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All of them are very rebellious,
    going around as slanderers.
They’re bronze and iron,
    and all of them are corrupt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The bellows blow fiercely to consume
    the lead with the fire.
The assayer keeps on refining,
    but the impurities aren’t separated out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They’re called reject silver,
    because the Lord has rejected them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The message that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Stand at the gate of the Lord’s Temple and proclaim this message there. Say, ‘Listen to this message from the Lord, all you people of Judah who come through these gates to worship the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord of the Heavenly Armies, the God of Israel, says:
“Change your ways and your deeds, and I’ll let you live in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t trust deceptive words like these, and say, ‘The Temple of the Lord, the Temple of the Lord, the Temple of the Lord,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but rather, truly change your ways and your deeds. If you truly practice justice between each person and his neighbor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if you don’t oppress the alien, the orphan, and the widow, and don’t shed an innocent person’s blood in this place, and if you don’t follow other gods to your own harm,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I’ll let you dwell in this land, the land that I gave to your ancestors forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Look, you’re trusting in deceptive words that cannot benefit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you steal, murder, commit adultery, swear by false gods, burn incense to Baal, follow other gods that you don’t know,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then come to stand before me in this house that is called by my name and say, ‘We’re delivered’ so we can continue to do all these things that are repugnant to God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has this house that is called by my name become a hideout for bandits in your eyes? Look, I’m watching,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go to my place that was in Shiloh, where I first caused my name to dwell. See what I did to it because of the evil of my people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, because you have done all these things,” declares the Lord, “I spoke to you over and over again, but you didn’t listen. I called to you, but you didn’t answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as I did to Shiloh, I’ll do to the house in which you trust and which is called by my name, the place that I gave to you and your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll cast you out of my sight, just as I cast out all your brothers, all the descendants of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, don’t pray on behalf of this people, don’t cry or offer a petition for them, and don’t plead with me, for I won’t listen to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you see what they’re doing in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children gather wood, the fathers kindle the fire, and the women knead dough to make cakes for the Queen of Heaven, and they pour out liquid offerings to other gods in order to provoke me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are they provoking me?” asks the Lord. “Is it not themselves, and to their own shame?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: “I’m about to pour out my anger and my wrath on this place, on people and animals, on the trees of the field, and on the fruit of the ground. It will burn, and it won’t be put out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord of the Heavenly Armies, the God of Israel, says:
“Add your burnt offerings to your sacrifices and eat the meat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, when I brought your ancestors out of the land of Egypt, I didn’t speak or command them about burnt offering and sacrifice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I did give them this command: ‘Obey me and I’ll be your God, and you will be my people. Walk in all the ways that I command you so it will go well for you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they didn’t listen, nor did they pay attention. They pursued their own plans, stubbornly following their own evil desires. They went backward and not forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the day your ancestors left the land of Egypt to this present time, I’ve sent all my servants, the prophets, to you, again and again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they didn’t listen to me, and they didn’t pay attention. They stiffened their necks, and they did more evil than their ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You will tell them all these things, but they won’t listen to you. You will call out to them, but they won’t answer you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will say to them, ‘This is the nation that wouldn’t listen to the voice of the Lord its God and wouldn’t accept correction. Truth has perished; it has been eliminated from their discussions.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “For the people of Judah have done evil in my eyes,” declares the Lord. “They have put their detestable idols in the house that is called by my name in order to defile it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have built high places at Topheth in the Valley of Ben-hinnom to burn their sons and daughters in the fire. I didn’t command this, and it never entered my mind!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, the time is near,” declares the Lord, “when it will no longer be called Topheth or the Valley of Ben-hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter. They’ll bury in Topheth because there is no other place to do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The dead bodies of these people will be food for the birds of the sky and for the animals of the land, and no one will disturb them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem I’ll bring an end to the sound of gladness and rejoicing, to the sounds of the bridegroom and bride, for the land will become a wasteland.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time,” declares the Lord, “the bones of the king of Judah, the bones of his officials, the bones of the priests, the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the residents of Jerusalem will be removed from their graves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They’ll be spread out to the sun, the moon, and all the stars of the heavens, which they loved and served, and which they followed, consulted, and worshipped. Their bones won’t be collected, nor will they be buried. They’ll be like dung on the surface of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In all the places where the people remain, where I’ve banished them, death will be chosen over life by all the remnant that remains of this evil family,” declares the Lord of the Heavenly Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You are to say to them, ‘This is what the Lord says:
“Will a person fall down and then not get up?
    Will someone turn away and then not turn back again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why has this people turned away?
    Why does Jerusalem continue in apostasy?
        They hold on to deceit and refuse to repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ve listened and I’ve heard,
    and what they say is not right.
No one repents of his evil and says,
    ‘What have I done?’
“They all turn to their own course
    like a horse racing into battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the stork in the sky knows its seasons,
    and the dove, the swallow, and the crane observe the time for migration.
But my people don’t know
    the requirements of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How can you say, ‘We’re wise,
    and the Law of the Lord is with us,’
when, in fact, the deceitful pen of the scribe has made it
    into something that deceives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise men will be put to shame.
    They’ll be dismayed and taken captive.
Look, they have rejected the message from the Lord!
    So what kind of wisdom do they have?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, I’ll give their wives to others,
    and their fields to new owners.
Indeed, from the least important to the most important,
    they’re all greedy for dishonest gain.
From prophet to priest,
    they all act deceitfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have treated my people’s wound
    superficially, telling them, ‘Peace, peace,’
        when there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are they ashamed because they have done
    what is repugnant to God?
They weren’t ashamed at all;
    they don’t even know how to blush!
Therefore they’ll fall with those who fall.
    When I punish them, they’ll be brought down,”
        says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I would have gathered them,”
    declares the Lord,
“but there were no grapes on the vine,
    and no figs on the fig tree,
and their leaves were withered.
    What I’ve given them has been taken away.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are we sitting here?
    Join together! Let’s go to the fortified cities
        and perish there!
For the Lord our God has condemned us to perish
    and given us poisoned water to drink,
        because we have sinned against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We waited for peace, but no good has come,
    for a time of healing, but instead there was terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The snorting of their horses is heard from Dan.
    At the neighing of their stallions,
        the whole earth quakes.
They’re coming to devour
    the land and all it contains,
        the city and all who live in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, I’ll send snakes among you,
    vipers that cannot be charmed,
        and they’ll bite you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Incurable sorrow has overwhelmed me,
    my heart is sick within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen! My people cry
    from a distant land:
“Is the Lord no longer in Zion?
    Is her king no longer there?”
“Why did they provoke me to anger with their images,
    with their worthless foreign gods?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The harvest is past,
    the summer has ended,
        and we haven’t been delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because my people are crushed, I’m crushed.
    I mourn, and dismay overwhelms me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is there no balm in Gilead?
    Is there no physician there?
        So why is there no healing for my people?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Oh, that my head were a spring of water,
and my eyes a fountain of tears,
for then I would cry day and night for those
    of my people who have been killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, that I had a lodging place for travelers in the desert,
    so that I could leave my people
        and go away from them.
For all of them are adulterers,
    a band of traitors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They use their tongues like a bow.
    Lies rather than truth fly throughout the land.
They progress from one evil to another,
    and they don’t know me,”
        declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Beware of your neighbors, and don’t trust
    any of your relatives.
For all of your relatives act deceitfully,
    and every friend goes around as a slanderer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People deceive their friends,
    and they don’t tell the truth.
They have taught their tongues to tell lies.
    They exhaust themselves practicing evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You yourself live in the midst of deception,
    and because they are deceived they do not know me,”
        declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, this is what the Lord of the Heavenly Armies says:
“Look, I’m about to refine and test them.
    Because they’re my people, what else can I do?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their tongue is a deadly arrow
    that speaks deceit.
With his mouth a person says, ‘Peace,’ to his friend,
    but inwardly he sets a trap for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should I not punish them for these things?”
    asks the Lord,
        “and should I not avenge myself on a nation like this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ll weep and mourn for the mountains,
    and lament for the desert pastures,
because they are desolate and no one passes through them.
    They don’t hear the lowing of the cattle.
Both the birds of the sky and the animals have fled.
    They’re gone!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I’ll make Jerusalem a heap of ruins,
    a refuge for jackals.
I’ll make the towns of Judah desolate,
    without inhabitants.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is the wise person who understands this, and to whom has the Lord spoken so that he may declare it? Why is the land destroyed, ruined like the desert, without anyone passing through it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “It is because they have forsaken my Law that I gave them. They didn’t obey me and didn’t live according to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, they followed their rebellious hearts and the Baals, as their ancestors taught them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord of the Heavenly Armies, the God of Israel, says: “Look, I’ll make these people eat wormwood and drink poisoned water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll scatter them among nations that neither they nor their ancestors have known, and I’ll pursue them with the sword until I’ve finished them off.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord of the Heavenly Armies says:
“Think about what I’m saying!
    Indeed, call out the professional mourners!
        Send for the best of them to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them hurry and lament for us.
    Let tears run down from our eyes,
        and let our eyelids flow with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a sound of mourning is heard from Zion:
    ‘How we’re ruined!
Our shame is very great,
    because we have left the land,
        because our houses are torn down.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Now, you women, hear the message from the Lord;
    listen to what he has to say!
Teach your daughters how to mourn,
    let every woman teach her friend how to lament.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For death comes up through our windows;
    it has come into our palaces
to eliminate children from the streets
    and young men from the town squares.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Speak! ‘This is what the Lord says:
“The corpses of people will fall like dung
    on the surface of the field,
and like a row of cut grain behind
    the harvester when there is no one to gather it.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says: “The wise man is not to boast in his wisdom; the strong man is not to boast in his strength; and the rich man is not to boast in his riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rather, let the one who boasts, boast in this: that he understands and knows me, for I am the Lord who acts with gracious love, justice, and righteousness in the land. I delight in these things,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Look, days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when I’ll punish all who are circumcised only in the flesh:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Egypt, Judah, Edom, the people of Ammon, Moab, all those who live in the desert and shave the corners of their beard; indeed all the other nations that are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel that is uncircumcised of heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear the message that the Lord has spoken to you, house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says:
“Don’t learn the way of the nations,
    and don’t be terrified by signs in the heavens,
    though the nations are terrified of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They decorate it with silver and gold.
    They secure it with nails and hammers
        so it won’t totter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their idols are like scarecrows in a cucumber field.
    They can’t speak!
They must always be carried
    because they can’t walk!
Don’t be afraid of them
    because they can do no harm,
        nor can they do any good.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no one like you, Lord.
    You are great, and your name is great and powerful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who wouldn’t fear you, king of the nations?
    This is what you deserve!
Indeed, among all the wise men of the nations,
    and throughout all their kingdoms,
        there is no one like you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Everyone is stupid and senseless.
    They follow worthless instruction
        from a piece of wood!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Beaten silver is brought from Tarshish,
    and gold from Uphaz.
The idols are the work of a craftsman
    and of the hands of a goldsmith.
Their clothing is violet and purple.
    The idols are all the work of skilled craftsmen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is the true God;
    he’s the living God and the everlasting king.
At his wrath the earth quakes,
    and the nations cannot endure his indignation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell this to them: “The gods who didn’t make the heavens and the earth will perish from the earth and from these heavens.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is the one who made
    the world by his power,
who established the earth by his wisdom
    and stretched out the heavens by his understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When his voice sounds there is thunder
    from the waters of heaven,
and he makes clouds rise up from
    the ends of the earth.
He makes lightning for the rain
    and brings wind out of his storehouses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Everyone is stupid and without knowledge.
    Every goldsmith is put to shame by his idols,
        for his images are false.
There is no life in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They’re worthless, a work of mockery,
    and when the time of punishment comes,
        they’ll perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Portion of Jacob is not like these.
    He made everything,
and Israel is the tribe of his inheritance.
    The Lord of the Heavenly Armies is his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who live under siege,
    Gather up your bundle from the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this is what the Lord says: 
“I’m going to throw out the inhabitants
    of the land at this time,
and I’ll bring distress on them
    so they’ll experience it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe is me because of my injury.
    My wound is severe.
I said, “Truly this is my sickness,
    and I must bear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My tent is destroyed,
    and all my tent cords are broken.
My sons have gone away from me,
    they no longer live.
There is no one to pitch my tent again
    and set up my curtains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because the shepherds are stupid
    and don’t seek the Lord,
therefore, they don’t prosper,
    and their flock is scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sound of a report, it’s coming now!
    There is a great commotion from a land in the north
to make the towns of Judah desolate,
    a refuge for jackals.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, I know that a person’s life is not his to control,
    nor does a person establish his way in life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, correct me, but with justice,
    not with anger.
        Otherwise, you’ll bring me to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: This is the message that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen to the words of this covenant, and convey them to the people of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are to say to them, ‘This is what the Lord God of Israel says: “Cursed is the person who does not listen to the words of this covenant
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which I commanded to your ancestors on the day I brought them out of the land of Egypt, from the iron furnace. I said, ‘Obey me and do everything that I commanded you. Then you will be my people and I’ll be your God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a result, I’ll fulfill the oath that I made with your ancestors to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, just as is the case today.”’”
Then I answered, “So be it, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told me, “Proclaim all these words in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem. You are to say, ‘Listen to the words of this covenant and do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I’ve diligently warned your ancestors from the day I brought them out of the land of Egypt until now, regularly warning them, saying, “Obey me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they would not listen or turn their ear, and each of them stubbornly followed his own evil desires. So I brought on them all the consequences of this covenant that I commanded them to fulfill, but they did not.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord told me, “Conspiracy has been found among the people of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have turned back to the iniquities of their ancestors of old who refused to listen to my words. They followed other gods to serve them. The house of Israel and the house of Judah broke my covenant which I made with their ancestors.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord says: “I’m about to bring disaster on them from which they won’t be able to escape. They’ll cry out to me, but I won’t listen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The towns of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem will go and cry out to the gods to whom they burn incense, but they’ll be no help at all to them in the time of their disaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah, you have as many gods as you have towns, and you have set up as many altars to the shameful idols as there are streets in Jerusalem. You burn incense to Baal on these altars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Jeremiah, don’t pray for this people and don’t cry or pray for them. I won’t listen when they cry out to me because of their disaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What right does my beloved have in my house,
    when she has carried out many evil schemes?
Can sacrificial flesh turn disaster away from you,
    so you can rejoice?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord once called you a green olive tree,
    with beautiful shape and fruit.
With a great roaring sound, he has set fire to it
    and its branches will be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of the Heavenly Armies who planted you has called for disaster on you because of the evil of the house of Israel and the house of Judah, has provoked me by burning incense to Baal.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord made it known to me,
    and so I understood.
        Then you showed me their malicious deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was like a gentle lamb
    led to the slaughter.
I didn’t know that they had devised schemes
    against me. They told themselves,
“Let’s destroy the tree with its fruit.
    Let’s eliminate him from the land of the living,
        so his name won’t be remembered again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord of the Heavenly Armies, the righteous judge,
    the one who tests feelings and the heart,
let me see your vengeance on them,
    for I’ve committed my case to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord says about the men of Anathoth who seek to kill you, all the while threatening you, “Don’t prophesy in the name of the Lord so you won’t die by our hand!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord of the Heavenly Armies says: “I’m about to punish them. The young men will die by the sword. Their sons and daughters will die by famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not one of them will be left, for I’ll bring disaster on the men of Anathoth when I punish them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are righteous, Lord,
even when I bring a complaint to you.
But I want to discuss justice with you.
    Why does the way of the wicked prosper,
        while all who are treacherous are at ease?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You plant them and they take root,
    they grow and bear fruit.
“You are near to us,” they say with their mouths,
    but the truth is that you’re far from their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You know me, Lord.
    You see me and test my thoughts toward you.
Pull the wicked out like sheep for slaughter;
    set them apart for the day of butchering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will the land mourn
    and the vegetation of every field dry up?
Because of the wickedness of those who live in it,
    animals and birds are swept away.
        For they say, “He does not see our future.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, if you run with others on foot,
    and they tire you out,
        how can you compete with horses?
You are secure in a land at peace,
    but how will you do in the thicket of the Jordan?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed, even your brothers and your father’s family
    conspire against you.
Even they cry out after you loudly.
    Don’t believe them, even though they speak friendly words to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ll forsake my house,
    I’ll abandon my inheritance.
I’ll give the beloved of my heart
    into the hand of her enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My inheritance has become like a lion in the forest to me.
    She roars at me; therefore, I hate her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is my inheritance like a speckled bird of prey to me?
    Are the other birds of prey all around her coming against her?
Go, gather all the wild animals and
    bring them to devour it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many shepherds will destroy my vineyard.
    They’ll trample down my portion.
They’ll turn my pleasant portion
    into a desolate desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They’ll make it into a desolate place,
    and, desolate, it will cry out in mourning to me.
The whole land will be desolate
    because no one takes it to heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On all the barren heights in the desert
    destroyers will come.
Indeed, a sword of the Lord will devour from
    one end of the land to the other.
There will be no peace for any person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have sown wheat,
    but they have harvested thorns.
They have tired themselves out,
    but they don’t show a profit.
Now be disappointed about your harvest
    because of the fierce anger of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord says about all the wicked neighbors who strike out against the land I’ve given to my people Israel as their inheritance: “I’m about to uproot them from their land, and I’ll uproot the house of Judah from among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After I’ve uprooted them, I’ll again have compassion on them. I’ll return each one of them to his inheritance, and each one to his own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they have learned the ways of my people well, to swear by my name: ‘As surely as the Lord lives,’ just as they once taught my people to swear by Baal, then they’ll be built up among my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they don’t listen, then I’ll completely uproot that nation and destroy it,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord told me: “Go and buy a linen belt for yourself, and put it around your waist. But don’t let it get wet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I bought the belt according to the Lord’s instruction, and put it around my waist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then this message from the Lord came to me a second time:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the belt that you bought and that is around your waist. Get up and go to the Euphrates, and hide it there in a crevice in the rock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I went and hid it at the Euphrates, just as the Lord had commanded me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After a long time, the Lord told me, “Arise, go to the Euphrates, and get the belt that I commanded you to hide there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I went to the Euphrates and dug it up. I got the belt from the place where I had hidden it. The belt was ruined! It was not good for anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then this message from the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord says: ‘In the same way I’ll ruin the pride of Judah and the pride of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This evil people that refuses to listen to my words, that stubbornly pursues their own desires, and that follows other gods to serve and worship them, will be like this belt that is not good for anything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as the belt clings tightly to a person’s waist, so I’ve made all the people of Israel and all the people of Judah cling tightly to me,’ declares the Lord. ‘I did this so that they would be my people, name, praise, and glory. But they wouldn’t listen.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what you’re to tell them: ‘This is what the Lord God of Israel says: “Every wineskin is to be filled with wine.”’ When they say to you, ‘Don’t we know very well that every wineskin is to be filled with wine?’,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then say to them, ‘This is what the Lord says: “I’m about to make all the inhabitants of this land drunk—the kings who sit on David’s throne, the priests, the prophets, and all the residents of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll smash them against each other, even fathers against their sons,” declares the Lord. “I’ll have no pity, mercy, or compassion when I destroy them.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen and pay attention!
    Don’t be proud, for the Lord has spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give glory to the Lord your God
    before he brings darkness,
before your feet stumble on the
    mountains at twilight.
You hope for light,
    but he turns it into deep darkness.
        He changes it into heavy gloom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you don’t listen, I’ll cry secretly
    because of your pride.
My eyes will cry bitterly, flowing tears,
    because the Lord’s flock has been taken captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to the king and the queen mother,
    “Come take a lowly seat,
because your beautiful crowns have fallen off your heads.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The towns in the Negev will be closed up,
    and there will be no one to open them.
All Judah will be taken into exile
    and be completely exiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Look up and see those who are coming from the north.
    Where is the flock that was given to you—
        your beautiful sheep?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What will you say when the Lord
    appoints over you as your head
        those whom you taught to be your allies?
Pain will seize you like that seizing a woman
    about to give birth, will it not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you say to yourselves,
    ‘Why have all these things happened to me?’
It’s because of the extent of your iniquity
    that your skirt has been lifted up,
        and your heels have suffered violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can an Ethiopian change his skin,
    or a leopard his spots?
Then you who are trained to do evil
    will also be able to do good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ll scatter them like chaff
    blown away by a desert wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“This is your fate,
    the portion I’ve measured out for you,”
        declares the Lord,
“because you have forgotten me
    and have trusted in false gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ll also pull your skirt up over your face,
    so your shame will be seen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ve seen your detestable behavior:
    your adulteries, your passionate neighing,
        your lewd immorality on the hills in the field.
How terrible it will be for you, Jerusalem!
    You are unclean. How much longer will this go on?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is this message from the Lord that came to Jeremiah concerning the drought:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Judah mourns, and her gates languish.
    The people mourn for the land,
    and the cry of Jerusalem goes up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their nobles send their young people for water.
    They go to the cisterns, but they find no water.
They return with their vessels empty.
    They’re disappointed and dismayed,
        and they cover their heads in shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ground is cracked,
    because there has been no rain in the land.
The farmers are disappointed,
    and they cover their heads in shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the doe in the field gives birth
    and then abandons her young
        because there is no grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wild donkeys stand on the barren hills.
    They pant for air like jackals.
Their eyesight fails
    because there is no vegetation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, even though our iniquities testify against us,
    do something for the sake of your name.
Indeed, our apostasies are many,
    and we have sinned against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hope of Israel,
    its deliverer in time of trouble,
why are you like a stranger in the land,
    like a traveler who sets up his tent for a night?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are you like a man taken by surprise,
    like a strong man who can’t deliver?
You are among us, Lord,
    and your name is the one by which we’re called.
        Don’t abandon us!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord says to these people:
    “Yes, they do love to wander,
        and they haven’t restrained their feet.
So the Lord won’t accept them now.
    He will remember their iniquity
        and punish their sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told me, “Don’t pray for the welfare of these people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although they fast, I won’t listen to their cry, and although they offer burnt offerings and grain offerings, I won’t accept them. Instead, I’ll put an end to them with the sword, with famine, and with a plague.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “Ah, Lord God, look! The prophets are saying to them, ‘You won’t see the sword and you won’t experience famine. Rather, I’ll give you lasting peace in this place.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told me, “The prophets are prophesying lies in my name. I didn’t send them, I didn’t command them, and I didn’t speak to them. They’re proclaiming to you false visions, worthless predictions, and the delusions of their own minds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord says about the false prophets who prophesy in my name, ‘There will be no sword and famine in this land’ (though I haven’t sent them): ‘By the sword and by famine these prophets will be finished off!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people to whom they have prophesied will be thrown out into the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword. There will be no one to bury them, their wives, their sons, or their daughters. I’ll pour out on them the judgment they deserve.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And deliver this message to them:
‘Let tears run down my face,
    night and day, and don’t let them stop,
because my virgin daughter—my people—
    will be broken with a powerful blow,
        with a severe wound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I go out into the field,
    I see those slain by the sword!
If I go into the city,
    I see the ravages of the famine!
Indeed, both prophet and priest
    ply their trade in the land,
        but they don’t know anything.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you completely rejected Judah?
    Do you despise Zion?
Why have you struck us,
    so that there is no healing for us?
We hoped for peace, but no good came,
    for a time of healing, but there was only terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We acknowledge, Lord, our wickedness,
    the guilt of our ancestors.
Indeed, we have sinned against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sake of your name don’t despise us.
    Don’t dishonor your glorious throne.
        Remember, don’t break your covenant with us!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can any of the worthless gods of the nations make it rain?
    Can the heavens themselves bring forth showers?
Aren’t you the one who does this,
    Lord our God?
So we hope in you,
    for you are the one who does all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord told me, “Even if Moses and Samuel were standing before me, I wouldn’t be favorably disposed toward this people. Send them out of my presence! Let them go!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“When they say to you, ‘Where can we go?’, say to them, ‘This is what the Lord says:
“Those destined for death,
    to death will go;
those destined for the sword,
    to the sword will go;
and those destined for captivity,
    to captivity will go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’ll appoint four kinds of judgment for them,” declares the Lord: “the sword to kill, the dogs to drag off, the birds of the sky to devour, and the animals of the land to destroy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll make them a horrifying sight to all the kingdoms of the earth because of what Hezekiah’s son Manasseh, king of Judah, did in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Who will have pity on you, Jerusalem,
    and who will grieve for you?
Who will go out of his way
    to ask about your welfare?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have deserted me,” declares the Lord.
    “You keep going backward.
I’ll reach out my hand and destroy you.
    I’m tired of showing compassion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ll winnow them with a winnowing fork
    in the gates of the land.
I’ll make them childless.
    I’ll destroy my people,
        for they didn’t change their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ll make their widows more numerous
    than the sand of the sea.
At noontime I’ll send a destroyer
    against the mother of a young man.
I’ll cause terror and anguish
    to come to her unexpectedly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The woman who gave birth to seven will grow faint,
    her life will expire.
Her sun will set while it’s still day.
    She will be disgraced and humiliated.
I’ll kill the rest of them with swords
    in the presence of their enemies,”
        declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How terrible for me, my mother,
    that you gave birth to me,
a man of strife and contention for the whole land!
    I’ve neither lent nor borrowed,
        yet everyone curses me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord said,
“Have I not set you free
    for a good purpose?
Have I not intervened for you with your enemies
    in times of trouble and times of distress?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Can anyone break iron—
    iron from the north—or bronze?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I’ll give away your wealth and your treasures
    as plunder, for free,
        because of all your sins throughout your territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ll make you serve your enemies
    in a land you don’t know,
for my anger has started a fire
    that will burn against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are aware—
    Lord, remember me,
pay attention to me,
    and vindicate me in front of those who pursue me.
You are patient—
    don’t take me away.
        Know that I suffer insult because of you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your words were found, and I consumed them.
    Your words were joy and my hearts delight,
because I bear your name,
    Lord God of the Heavenly Armies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I didn’t sit in the company of those who have fun,
    and I didn’t rejoice.
Because of your hand on me, I sat alone,
    for you filled me with indignation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why is my pain unending and my wound incurable,
    refusing to be healed?
You are like a deceptive brook,
    whose waters cannot be depended on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, this is what the Lord says:
    “If you repent, I’ll take you back
        and you will stand before me.
If you speak what is worthwhile,
    instead of what is worthless,
        then you will be my spokesman.
People will turn to you,
    but you aren’t to turn to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ll make you a fortified wall of bronze to this people.
    They’ll fight against you,
but they won’t prevail against you,
    for I am with you to save you
        and deliver you,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I’ll deliver you from the hand of the wicked,
    and redeem you from the grasp of the ruthless.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This message from the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You are not to take a wife, nor are you to have sons or daughters in this place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord says about the sons and daughters who are born in this place, about their mothers who give birth to them, and about their fathers who father them in this land:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They’ll die of deadly diseases. People won’t mourn for them, nor will they be buried. They’ll be dung on the surface of the ground, and they’ll come to an end with the sword and with famine. Their dead bodies will be food for the birds of the sky and the animals of the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord says: “Don’t go to a house where there is mourning, don’t go to lament, nor to express sorrow to them. For I’ve taken my peace away from this people,” declares the Lord, “as well as gracious love and compassion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both the most and the least important people will die in this land, and they won’t be buried. People won’t mourn for them. They won’t cut themselves, nor will they shave their heads for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They won’t break bread for the mourner to be consoled for the dead. They won’t give anyone the cup of consolation to drink for his father or mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t go to a banquet to sit with people to eat and drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord of the Heavenly Armies, the God of Israel, says: “In this place I’m about to bring an end to the sounds of happiness and rejoicing, the sounds of the bridegroom and the bride. I’ll do it in front of your eyes and in your time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you speak all these words to this people, they’ll say to you, ‘Why has the Lord pronounced all this disaster against us? What is our iniquity, and what is the sin that we have committed against the Lord our God?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then say to them, ‘It is because your ancestors abandoned me,’ declares the Lord. ‘They followed other gods, served them, worshipped them, abandoned me, and didn’t keep my Law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have done even more evil than your ancestors, and each one of you is stubbornly following his own evil desires, refusing to listen to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ll throw you out of this land into a land neither you nor your ancestors have known. There you will serve other gods day and night, and I’ll show you no favor.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when it will no longer be said, ‘As surely as the Lord lives, who brought up the Israelis from the land of Egypt.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rather it will be said, ‘As surely as the Lord lives, who brought the Israelis up from the land of the north and from all the lands to which the Lord had banished them.’ I’ll bring them back to their land, which I gave to their ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’m about to send many fishermen,” declares the Lord, “and they’ll catch them. Afterwards, I’ll send for many hunters and they’ll hunt for them on every mountain and hill and in the crevices of the rocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am watching all their ways; they are not hidden from my sight. Their iniquity is not concealed from my eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: First I’ll repay them double for their iniquity and their sin, because they have polluted my land with the dead bodies of their detestable images, and they have filled my inheritance with their abominations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, my strength and my stronghold,
    my refuge in a time of difficulty,
to you the nations will come,
    and from the ends of the earth they’ll say,
“Surely our ancestors inherited deception,
    things that are worthless,
        and in which there is no profit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can a person make a god for himself?
    They are not gods!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, I’m about to make them understand;
    this time I’ll make them understand
my power and strength,
    so they’ll understand that my name is the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sin of Judah is engraved
with an iron stylus.
